result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monquel J Harper

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion for Dismissal of Case.  (Monquel J. Harper - #2022009015, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant Motion to Change Plea, filed.
STATES WITNESS LIST, filed.

Defendant Monquel J Harper in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Monquel J Harper.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defense motion to adjourn the 10/10/2022 jury trial heard and granted. Matter remains calendared in Branch 38.  Parties to continue to negotiate the case.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for Adjournment of Jury Trial, received and filed
filed.
filed.
ADDENDUM TO STATES WITNESS LIST; filed.
filed.
NOTICE OF INTENT TO USE DNA EVIDENCE AT TRIAL; filed.
All previous conditions remain the same.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sara W., Johnny W., AND Elisabeth W.   Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 21 days. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Monquel J Harper not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Scheduling conference. Defense request to be heard on bail. Bail motion by Defense argued and partially GRANTED by the Court. Cash Bond Set at $25,000.00.   All conditions remain the same.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Monquel J Harper in court, appear by video with attorney Matt Last, appear by video.  Defendant Monquel J Harper in custody.  Ian F Vance-Cuzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective S. Lasniwski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Motion for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  bm
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Adjustment Number: 22A 071196,
Payable Number: 1022263,
Receipt Number: 22RP030155,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with L S; D L S; B M S
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Monquel J Harper in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Monquel J Harper in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Monquel J Harper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
